Articles.Content:
Hello, I Got KSP 0.9 1 hour ago but when i tried to launch it, it crash when the loading screen on 45%. I never get this crash when i use 0.25... So Can i get any advice or solution to fix this ?

Error Log :

https://www.facebook.com/download/741678735917557/error.log

Output Log :

https://www.facebook.com/download/1520811028196543/output_log.txt

I Got :

RAM : 4 GB

VGA : NVIDIA Gtx 660 Ti

Your log seems to indicate that you are running out of memory. I recommend trying to bump down the Texture Quality a little. If the game isn't loading, you can manually change the Texture Quality by editing the settings.cfg with a plain text editor (such as notepad). Search for the line "TEXTURE_QUALITY =" and change it to "TEXTURE_QUALITY = 1" (or even try 2 or 3). Restart the game. Sometimes after running KSP with this changed setting, you can go back and bump the texture quality back up a notch.

Cheers,

~Claw

Your log seems to indicate that you are running out of memory. I recommend trying to bump down the Texture Quality a little. If the game isn't loading, you can manually change the Texture Quality by editing the settings.cfg with a plain text editor (such as notepad). Search for the line "TEXTURE_QUALITY =" and change it to "TEXTURE_QUALITY = 1" (or even try 2 or 3). Restart the game. Sometimes after running KSP with this changed setting, you can go back and bump the texture quality back up a notch.

Cheers,

~Claw

Thanks for your advice, but it still crashed when it load Mk1cockpitinternal models, and i start it again with Task manager on. The RAM Bar is not full yet, Then suddenly crash and the RAM back to 985 MB from 2.35 GB
Oh, i finally fix this.... i deleted the Setting.cfg and it worked all along...
